metadata.title: CVE-2020-10188 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
utility.c in telnetd in netkit telnet through 0.17 allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary code via short writes or urgent data, because of abuffer overflow involving the netclear and nextitem functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

telnet - 0.17-41.2build1
telnetd - 0.17-41.2build1
No subscription required

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-ping - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-talk - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-tools - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netkit-telnet package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17-41.2build1').
netkit-telnet-ssl package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
inetutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1').
